t: Proverbs 29
Warnings and Instructions
A*pn man who hardens his*i neck after much reproof Will*ln suddenly be broken beyond remedy.
When*ln the righteous increase, the people rejoice, But*ln when a wicked man rules, people groan.
A*ln man who loves wisdom makes his father glad, But*ln he who keeps company with harlots wastes his*i wealth.
The*ln king gives stability to the land by justice, But*ln a man who takes bribes overthrows it.
A*ln man who flatters his neighbor Is*ln spreading a net for his steps.
By*ln transgression an evil man is ensnared, But*ln the righteous sings and rejoices.
The*ln righteous is concerned for the rights of the poor, The*ln wicked does not understand such*i concern.
Scorners*ln set a city aflame, But*ln wise men turn away anger.
When*ln a wise man has a controversy with a foolish man, The*ln foolish man either rages or laughs, and there is no rest.
Men*ln of bloodshed hate the blameless, But*ln the upright are concerned for his life.
A*ln fool always loses his temper, But*ln a wise man holds it back.
If*ln a ruler pays attention to falsehood, All*ln his ministers become*i wicked.
The*ln poor man and the oppressor have this in common: The*ln Lord*s gives light to the eyes of both.
If*ln a king judges the poor with truth, His*ln throne will be established forever.
The*ln rod and reproof give wisdom, But*ln a child who gets his own way brings shame to his mother.
When*ln the wicked increase, transgression increases; But*ln the righteous will see their fall.
Correct*ln your son, and he will give you comfort; He*ln will also delight your soul.
Where*ln there is no vision, the people are unrestrained, But*ln happy is he who keeps the law.
A*ln slave will not be instructed by words alone;*i For*ln though he understands, there will be no response.
Do*ln you see a man who is hasty in his words? There*ln is more hope for a fool than for him.
He*ln who pampers his slave from childhood Will*ln in the end find him to be a son.
An*ln angry man stirs up strife, And*ln a hot-tempered man abounds in transgression.
A*ln man’s pride will bring him low, But*ln a humble spirit will obtain honor.
He*ln who is a partner with a thief hates his own life; He*ln hears the oath but tells nothing.
The*ln fear of man brings a snare, But*ln he who trusts in the Lord*s will be exalted.
Many*ln seek the ruler’s favor, But*ln justice for man comes*i from the Lord.*s
An*ln unjust man is abominable to the righteous, And*ln he who is upright in the way is abominable to the wicked.
